nodes.text: Most of you did very well upon the written essay part of the previous day's quiz. Let us find out how well you did upon the Thieves' Tools section.
Fr√§ulein Esme, what did you find in your assigned locker?
I found Germania volf coin, sir.
Sehr gut.
Herr Kent, what did you find in the locker?
I found a medal of honor, Master.
(Nod) Indeed.
Herr Sosi, what was in your locker?
I found a dagger in my locker, Master von Urwald.
Indeed, Herr Sosi. And what was significantly unique about the dagger you found in the locker?
Unique, sir? I don't know what you are saying.
Using your exceptional skills of perception, did you not notice anything unusual about the dagger in the locker?
(whispered) Snake handle!
Did you say something, Herr Kyro?
No sir, I didn't say anything, sir.
The dagger had a snake design on the handle, Master.
How observant of you.
Fr√§ulein MacMichael, what did you find in your locker?
I found a miniature galleon in a bottle.
Good.
I didn't manage to open the locker. I couldn't get the stupid lockpick to work.
You disappoint me, Fr√§ulein. I should think that with all the resources at this school and practice time available, you could manage to open one minor lock.
I'm sorry, sir.
And now, Herr O'Conner, what did you find in your pre-assigned locker?
I found a 'Big Book of Tool Use" manual, sir.
I found something that I obviously didn't need, and clearly couldn't use if I had needed it.
Sehr gut, Herr O'Conner.

If only you had followed the instructions of the test and left the item in the locker, you would have passed that part of the exam. You have a failing score on this test until that book is returned. See me after class.
I didn't manage to get my locker open.
I see... Which means that you didn't manage to get a passing grade, either.
I've been practicing my lockpicking for days, so I knew that I could pass your test without a problem. Unfortunately, when I started to pick the lock on locker 13, my pick wore out and broke.

I immediately went down to the store to buy a new set of picks, but I didn't have any money. Gregor suggested that I earn money by killing Drats for him, so I went into the wine cellar to look for them.
In the wine cellar, I discovered a hidden room where an old hero of the castle had been murdered. I spent all yesterday giving the hero a proper burial so that his ghost could rest easily.

Unfortunately, by the time I had finished giving the hero last rites, Gregor had gone off to bed and I didn't manage to buy a new set of rogue tools. So I'll have to buy some later today. Then I'll have no trouble opening the locker.
That is an inventive, if not totally believable, excuse. However, it does not absolve you from failure.
Would you believe I found an empty locker?
No, I would not. Nor do I believe that I will give you a passing grade on this exam.
As for the essay part of the exam, you all gave some very interesting responses.
In particular, Fr√§ulein Esme, you did very well.

nodes.name: Mission Esme Accomplished!
nodes.description: Esme passed the Rogue Test with flying colors with my help. It's kind of nice to do something good for someone else once in a while - as long as I don't make a habit of it. After all, I don't want to turn out to be a Hero, do I?

nodes.text: I thank Shawn for telling me to speak to you about my problem.
It was wise of you both to do so.

nodes.name: Mission Esme Accomplished!
nodes.description: Esme passed the Rogue Test with flying colors with my help - and Thomas'. It's kind of nice to do something good for someone else once in a while, as long as I don't make a habit of it. After all, I don't want to turn out to be a Hero, do I?

nodes.text: Thomas helped me study for test. I could not have done it without his aid.
And Shawn... he helped me, too. He kept telling me that I could vork things out, and he vas right.

nodes.name: Esme Didn't Need My Help
nodes.description:
So things worked out fine for Esme and her problem with the test, just as I figured it would. I didn't have to lift a finger to help Esme. 

Then again, maybe I should have done more to help her. She'd probably like me better. Now Thomas gets all the credit.

nodes.text: I thank Thomas for his help to study for test.
Very good, Herr Thomas. You are clearly in the competion to become the Rogue of the Year.
But sir, that wasn't why I tutored Esme! She just needed a little help and I was happy to help her.
Nevertheless, kindness is a desirable trait for a Rogue.
Keep that favor in mind when we decide the winner of the Rogue of the Year contest. Helping your comrades is a very Roguish thing to do.
Perfect scores went to Fr√§ulein Esme, Herr Kent, Herr Sosi, Herr Kyro, and Herr O'Conner. Good work.
Four of you did exceptionally well on the test. Fr√§ulein MacMichael and Herr O'Conner, you shall have to work to catch up with your peers.
Fr√§ulein Esme, Herr Kent, Herr Kyro, and Herr Sosi answered everything to my satisfaction. Fr√§ulein MacMichael, Herr O'Conner, I expect better of you next time.

nodes.message: Checking Scores and Shawn is doing poorly on tests

nodes.text: Herr O'Conner, you continue to disappoint me. If you do not improve your score in the next exam, then you demonstrate clearly that you do not belong at this school.
I should hate to think that Herr Terk's low opinion of your abilities is justified.
This was not your best performance, Herr O'Conner. I suggest that you work harder for the next exam.

Now that most of you have mastered the basics of picking locks, know that many locks are specifically designed to resist being picked. For such locks, you will need the Houdini 42 Advanced Lockpicking Toolkit.

nodes.name: Houdini Who?
nodes.description: Now for Rogues class, we're told to buy a Houdini 42 tool. I guess if I want to pick tougher locks, I'll need it. The Master also told us we should study the Houdini 42 section of the Beginner's Guilde to Lockpicks for more insight.

nodes.text: With the Houdini 42, you will be able to unlock more complicated locks and safes. Study that section of your lockpicking manual tonight for further mastery of the skill.
Tomorrow's lesson will be one on ethics and morality as we discuss Rogues versus Thieves. In the meantime, improve your skills.
Auf Wiedersehen.
